The plant produces yellow globular flowers in late winter to early spring, which are clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences. It is adapted to low rainfall and nutrient-poor soils, making it a resilient component of desert ecosystems. The species is also valued for its role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for native fauna.
